function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Regular data collection and monitoring of electricity use in housing units may lead to increased human contact in the built environment, potentially facilitating the spread of contagious diseases.","Impact":"Increased human contact in the built environment can lead to higher risk of contagious disease transmission, contributing to public health concerns.","Mitigation":"Implement remote data collection methods or use automated energy monitoring systems to minimize human contact during data collection.","Technologies":"Automated energy monitoring systems, IoT (Internet of Things) devices for remote data collection, smart meters for real-time energy monitoring.","People":"Residents, data collectors, maintenance staff, and anyone involved in the data collection process.","Owner":"Building management, energy monitoring system providers, housing authorities."},{"Description":"Submetering of building energy usage requires physical installation of CT coils on each circuit, potentially increasing the exposure of maintenance staff and installers to contagious diseases.","Impact":"Increased physical contact during installation and maintenance activities can heighten the risk of disease transmission among maintenance staff and installers.","Mitigation":"Provide personal protective equipment (PPE) to maintenance staff and installers, implement strict hygiene protocols and social distancing measures during installation and maintenance activities.","Technologies":"Automated CT coil installation systems, remote CT coil monitoring and maintenance systems.","People":"Maintenance staff, installers, and anyone involved in the installation and maintenance of CT coils.","Owner":"Building management, energy monitoring system providers, maintenance contractors."},{"Description":"Limited monitoring of certain circuits due to the constraints of the home energy monitoring system may result in incomplete data collection, affecting the accuracy of energy use analysis.","Impact":"Incomplete data collection may lead to inaccurate assessments of energy usage, potentially resulting in inefficient energy management strategies.","Mitigation":"Implement advanced energy monitoring systems with higher input capacity, conduct regular maintenance and calibration of monitoring equipment.","Technologies":"Advanced energy monitoring systems with multiple input channels, IoT devices for comprehensive energy monitoring, predictive maintenance systems for monitoring equipment maintenance.","People":"Data analysts, energy management professionals, maintenance staff responsible for monitoring equipment.","Owner":"Data analysis team, building management, energy monitoring system providers."}]}
